articles.title: Ten British AI breakthroughs set to cut bills and heat homes more efficiently
articles.description: Millions of families could see warmer homes and lower energy bills, as ministers back ten new AI innovations which will help make the UK a clean energy superpower through the government’s Plan for Change.

articles.source: NIST News
articles.title: NIST and Partners Use Quantum Mechanics to Make a Factory for Random Numbers
articles.description: Broadcast as a free public service, the beacon can be used anywhere an independent source of random numbers would be useful, such as selecting jury candidates or assigning resources through a lottery.

articles.source: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology - Activity on GOV.UK
articles.title: PM unveils AI breakthrough to slash planning delays and help build 1.5 million homes: 9 June 2025
articles.description: Planning permissions will be sped up as the Government rolls out a new AI tool which can scan hundreds of files in seconds – making it easier to make home improvements, while turbocharging the Plan for Change milestone to build 1.5 million homes.

articles.source: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology - Activity on GOV.UK
articles.title: Top talent backed with master's funding as Britain's tech experts called into government
articles.description: The Spärck AI scholarships will provide full funding for master's degrees at 9 leading UK universities specialising in AI and STEM subjects.
